snippet: In the flooded Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, engineers are using shafts that were designed to pump air in to pump out water that flooded during Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Efforts to reopen the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel continue; engineers are using existing air shafts to pump out water and allow for an inspection of the two-mile long structure; earth-moving machinery will then enter the tunnel for removal of mud and debris.
lead_paragraph: In the flooded Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, engineers are using shafts that were designed to pump air in to pump out water that flooded during Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: At Bottom of Brooklyn Tunnel, Seeing Some Light
headline.main: Deep in a Flooded Tunnel, Mud and a Little Bit of Light
headline.print_headline: Deep in a Flooded Tunnel, Mud and a Little Bit of Light
